title: Thursday morning news briefing: Three days to move a mountain
text:
Victims of dog theft have bone to pick as prosecutions fall

Police have been accused of not treating dog thefts seriously enough because most of the animals are worth less than £500. Campaigners are complaining that thieves are not being pursued by police because the crime is rated a minor, low-level offence. As Home Affairs Editor Charles Hymas explains, new research shows dog-stealing has become a low-risk, high-reward crime.

'Grand Designs curse': Kevin McCloud calls in liquidators

In a case of life imitating art, companies linked to Grand Designs presenter Kevin McCloud have collapsed after hitting financial problems - leaving small investors facing big losses. Mr McCloud's television series frequently highlights projects hitting the rocks as budgets spiral out of control, technical problems crop up and delays push back moving-in dates. Alan Tovey reports that it seems what some see as the "curse of Grand Designs" has come home to roost.
